interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/08/02 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Gillian Armstrong'], 'Producers': ['Sarah Curtis', 'Douglas Rae'], 'Starring': ['Cate Blanchett', 'Billy Crudup', 'Michael Gambon'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']} Review Text: If you're drawn to romance and historical films, then you will like this movie. Cate Blanchett is excellent in her role as a young British girl devoted to her country and determined to help in the war efforts of WWII. Supporting actors help develop the plot.
I was moved with the one of the themes of this film that being helping Jewish people escape the horrible fate that would await them once in the hands of the Nazis.
Cinematography is superb. Review Title: Beautiful film in many ways Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Terry McDonagh'], 'Starring': ['Ray Winstone', 'Suranne Jones'], 'Studio': ['FilmRise']} On a whim, I came across this British mystery series and decided to watch. I'm on the 2nd season and have thoroughly enjoyed the series ... it's too bad that it ends with 2nd season. would've been nice to have more added. On a whim {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Byrum Geisler'], 'Producers': ['Brandon Garza', 'Alex Bice', 'Wes Ross'], 'Starring': ['Ethan Sharrett', 'Chase Conner', 'Brandi Price'], 'Studio': ['Washington House']} I decided to give this film 5 stars because of the movie's themes even though the story was somewhat slow to develop. These are new actors that I wasn't familiar with but I especially developed a strong bond with Ben Bennett. You could see how much he wanted to tell Lee about his feelings but was afraid to do so.
The film deals with the real problems that a relationship like this one can bring. It was moving to see a happy ending like this one. Makes You Think {'Content advisory': ['Smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['John Korty', 'Arthur Hiller'], 'Producers': ['David Golden', 'Howard G. Minsky'], 'Starring': ['Ali MacGraw', "Ryan O'Neal", 'John Marley'], 'Studio': ['Paramount Pictures']} I watched this in 1970 & loved it. Now 49 yrs later, it still has the same effect ... a universal love theme with a sad ending. superb acting by R. O'Neal and A. McGraw Epic Love Story {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Alejandro Bazzano'], 'Producers': ['Nacho Manubens', 'Sonia Martinez', 'Josep Cister Rubio', 'Aitor Montanchez'], 'Starring': ['Miguel angel Muñoz', 'Susi Sanchez', 'Elvira Minguez'], 'Studio': ['Atresmedia Television']} This was one of the best productions I've seen from Spain. Beautiful cinematography and breathtaking scenes of the Basque country. One of the reasons I chose to watch it is just that to see the country scenes. This seems to be a "film noir" type with a good plot and an unexpected ending. All new actors for me however, I had seen Susi Sanchez acting in a previous Spanish film. The only thing that I felt was NOT NECESSARY were all the sex scenes in the earlier episodes ... don't believe this contributed to the plot or if they had to throw in sex, the directors could have given it a "softer" touch ... I didn't dock any stars for that though. For those language fans out there, there's a lot of the Basque language you see in the film ... and I picked up some of the simpler Basque greetings. Recommended for mature audiences. Good Acting and Unexpected Ending Ashes in the Snow Historical, Romance, Downbeat, Emotional ["During World War II, a 16 year-old aspiring artist and her family are deported to Siberia amidst Stalin's brutal dismantling of the Baltic region. One girl's passion for art and her never-ending hope will break the silence of history."] {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Marius Markevicius'], 'Producers': ['Marius Markevicius', 'Zilvinas Naujokas', 'Chris Coen', 'Prithvi Chavan'], 'Starring': ['Bel Powley', 'Sophia Cookson', 'Lisa Loven Kongsli']} If I could give this 10 stars I would. I always enjoy historical films and I was blown away by this film. Beautiful cinematography and outstanding acting. Although it had some violent scenes, I believe the film conveyed the message how these innocent families struggled, survived and perished under Stalin's rule. Recommended for those interested in history. Extraordinary historical account {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Rose Bosch'], 'Producers': ['Jean-Robert Gibard', 'Alain Goldman', 'Catherine Morisse', 'Christer von Lindequist'], 'Starring': ['Jean Reno', 'Melanie Laurent', 'Gad Elmaleh'], 'Studio': ['Menemsha Films']} An explicit historical account of the Velodrome d'hiver Round up (La Rafle) in Paris where thousands of Jews were arrested in mass and placed in extremely crowded conditions at the velodrome.
A very emotional film depicting the horror of mass murder of innocent people in transit to Auschwitz.
Beautiful cinematography and outstanding acting. Highly recommended for those interested in historical drama. Emotional Account of the Vel D'Hiver Round up in Paris Bitter Harvest (2016) Action, Drama, Gritty, Harrowing ['Starring Academy Award® nominee Terence Stamp, BITTER HARVEST is a powerful story of survival, honor, and rebellion told through the eyes of two star-crossed lovers.'] {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['George Mendeluk'], 'Producers': ['Stuart Baird', 'Chard Barager', 'Jaye Gazeley', 'Ian Ihnatowycz'], 'Starring': ['Max Irons', 'Samantha Barks', 'Barry Pepper']} The film had superb cinematography. This was a historical drama in remembrance of the Holodomor Genocide in Ukraine 1932-33.
I had never heard of this horrific tragedy in the history of mankind. It was a sad representation of the horrors of the Ukranian people but at the same time showing the determination of the people's desire to fight back.
Highly recommended for world history students. Bitter Harvest - Remembering the genocide in Ukraine 1932-33 {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Gillian Armstrong'], 'Producers': ['Sarah Curtis', 'Douglas Rae'], 'Starring': ['Cate Blanchett', 'Billy Crudup', 'Michael Gambon'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']} If you're drawn to romance and historical films, then you will like this movie. Cate Blanchett is excellent in her role as a young British girl devoted to her country and determined to help in the war efforts of WWII. Supporting actors help develop the plot.
I was moved with the one of the themes of this film that being helping Jewish people escape the horrible fate that would await them once in the hands of the Nazis.
Cinematography is superb. Beautiful film in many ways
profile:
**User Summary:**

- **Content Preference:** The user continues to be drawn to British mystery series and international productions, with a strong appreciation for beautiful cinematography and historical narratives. They show a particular interest in films that explore significant historical events with emotional depth, especially those reflecting themes of love and resilience in the face of adversity. Character-driven storytelling remains central to their preferences.

- **Engagement Style:** The user engages spontaneously with both series and films, favoring narratives that evoke strong emotional responses. They appreciate various genres, especially those grounded in gritty historical contexts that feature compelling character development.

- **Viewing Habits:** The user enjoys longer series and standalone films that delve deeply into character arcs and convey substantial emotional weight. They value unique cultural elements and thoughtful resolutions in narratives.

- **Language:** Prefers English content but is open to foreign films with subtitles, enhancing their engagement.

- **Emotional Response:** The user showcases a profound appreciation for intricate storytelling with emotional complexity, particularly narratives portraying historical tragedies and human resilience. They express enthusiasm in reviews, as evidenced by their recent high ratings for emotionally rich historical dramas.

- **Rating Behavior:** The user rates content variably (3.0 to 5.0). A recent 5-star rating highlights their enthusiasm for romance and historical themes, particularly when addressing poignant issues such as humanitarian efforts during WWII.

Overall, the user demonstrates a clear affinity for intricate, emotionally resonant narratives that intertwine history, depth, and compelling character arcs.
